item.title: Web Maps
item.description:
The main goal of this project was to developed web mapping applications for environmental and territorial management in the Aragua state. These web maps were the first mapping tools developed to help regional government staff to visualize geospatial data about the environment and land use planning. The web mapping applications contain information about land use planning, roads, hydrography, urban areas, protected areas, administrative boundaries, and current and potential mining activities. The main portal of the project shows 4 web mapping application and one mobile application. Three apps are for land use planning and two apps are for mining.

Link to web mapping applications http://proteccionambiental.aragua.gob.ve/mapas

item.title: Story Map
item.description:
The main goal of this activity was to create an ArcGIS StoryMap to show the shoreline dynamics of the Valencia lake and the magnitude of Land Use and Land Cover changes in Zamora Municipality, Venezuela from 1986 to 2014. This StoryMap was conceived as a means to show the results of a postgraduate thesis, and to take part in the National Award for Geographical Information System 2018 (NASIG), ESRI-Venezuela. We opted to build an ArcGIS StoryMap because it is an application based on the web and the ArcGIS platform that allows developer to share maps in a setting containing narrative text and multimedia. This story map won the third prize for the best Story Map, more details here.

Story Map link https://arcg.is/0OPDrq

item.title: Geoportal INSAI
item.description:
The Geoportal INSAI was conceived as a tool to leverage the national plant protection and animal health system in Venezuela. It was based on open-source software, using MapServer for publishing geospatial data, in conjunction with i3Geo, which is an application for developing interactive web maps.

Geoportal INSAI displayed several predefined web map interfaces: regions, INSAI's offices, transit permits, epidemiology reports, and so on. Equally, it was possible that a user could create his own map and make spatial analysis directly on the web.

Unfortunately, this geoportal is currently offline. However, you can obtain more information about this project from the gvSIG association by clicking here and here.

item.title: Mining Geoportal
item.description:
The main goal of the Mining Geoportal (GeoMiNa) is to serve as a central repository for all data related to mining activities in Venezuela. GeoMiNa is a free and open data resource intended to support public and private management in the mining sector, as well as a means to exchange data between stakeholders. GeoMiNaâ€™s users will be the staff of the Mining Ministry (MPPDME) and the Institute for Geology and Mining (INGEOMIN), who will use the data for mining research and planning in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela.

Link: http://sigminas.desarrollominero.gob.ve
